00002 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00003 
00004 ##############################################
00005 #
00006 #  Implements functions that are common to
00007 #  the new Parser.pm and the old PGauxiliaryFunctions.pl
00008 #
00009 
00010 =cut
00011 
00012 sub _PGcommonFunctions_init {}
00013 
00014 #
00015 #  Make these interact nicely with Parser.pm
00016 #
00017 package CommonFunction;
00018 
00019 =head3 NOTE
00020 
00021 #
00022 #  Either call Parser (if it has been loaded) or
00023 #  the functions below.  (If it's ever the case
00024 #  that both the Parser and PGauxiliaryFunctions.pl are
00025 #  both preloaded, then there will be no need for
00026 #  this, as you can always use the Parser versions.
00027 #  We only need this because Parser might not be loaded.)
00028 #
00029 
00030 =cut
00031 
00032 sub Call {
00033   my $self = shift;
00034   my $fn = shift;
00035   if ($main::_parser_loaded) {
00036     return Parser::Function->call($fn,@_)
00037       if Parser::Context->current->{functions}{$fn};
00038   }
00039   return &{$CommonFunction::function{$fn}}(@_) if $CommonFunction::function{$fn};
00040   return $self->$fn(@_);
00041 }
00042 
00043 sub log {CORE::log($_[1])}
00044 sub ln  {CORE::log($_[1])}
00045 sub logten {CORE::log($_[1])/CORE::log(10)}
00046 
00047 sub tan {CORE::sin($_[1])/CORE::cos($_[1])}
00048 sub cot {CORE::cos($_[1])/CORE::sin($_[1])}
00049 sub sec {1/CORE::cos($_[1])}
00050 sub csc {1/CORE::sin($_[1])}
00051 
00052 sub asin {CORE::atan2($_[1],CORE::sqrt(1-$_[1]*$_[1]))}
00053 sub acos {CORE::atan2(CORE::sqrt(1-$_[1]*$_[1]),$_[1])}
00054 sub atan {CORE::atan2($_[1],1)}
00055 sub acot {CORE::atan2(1,$_[1])}
00056 sub asec {acos($_[0],1.0/$_[1])}
00057 sub acsc {asin($_[0],1.0/$_[1])}
00058 
00059 sub sinh {(CORE::exp($_[1])-CORE::exp(-$_[1]))/2}
00060 sub cosh {(CORE::CORE::exp($_[1])+CORE::CORE::exp(-$_[1]))/2}
00061 sub tanh {(CORE::exp($_[1])-CORE::exp(-$_[1]))/(CORE::exp($_[1])+CORE::exp(-$_[1]))}
00062 sub sech {2/(CORE::exp($_[1])+CORE::exp(-$_[1]))}
00063 sub csch {2.0/(CORE::exp($_[1])-CORE::exp(-$_[1]))}
00064 sub coth {(CORE::exp($_[1])+CORE::exp(-$_[1]))/(CORE::exp($_[1])-CORE::exp(-$_[1]))}
00065 
00066 sub asinh {CORE::log($_[1]+CORE::sqrt($_[1]*$_[1]+1.0))}
00067 sub acosh {CORE::log($_[1]+CORE::sqrt($_[1]*$_[1]-1.0))}
00068 sub atanh {CORE::log((1.0+$_[1])/(1.0-$_[1]))/2.0}
00069 sub asech {CORE::log((1.0+CORE::sqrt(1-$_[1]*$_[1]))/$_[1])}
00070 sub acsch {CORE::log((1.0+CORE::sqrt(1+$_[1]*$_[1]))/$_[1])}
00071 sub acoth {CORE::log(($_[1]+1.0)/($_[1]-1.0))/2.0}
00072 
00073 sub sgn {$_[1] <=> 0}
00074 
00075 sub C {
00076   shift; my ($n,$r) = @_; my $C = 1;
00077   return(0) if ($r>$n);
00078   $r = $n-$r if ($r > $n-$r); # find the smaller of the two
00079   for (1..$r) {$C = ($C*($n-$_+1))/$_}
00080   return $C;
00081 }
00082 
00083 sub P {
00084   shift; my ($n,$r) = @_; my $P = 1;
00085   return(0) if ($r>$n);
00086   for (1..$r) {$P *= ($n-$_+1)}
00087   return $P;
00088 }

00093 #
00094 package main;
00095 
00096 #
00097 #  Make main versions call the checker to see
00098 #  which package-specific version to call
00099 #
00100 
00101 Parser::defineLog(); ## defined in dangerousMacros so warning about redefining log() can be avoided
00102 
00103 sub ln     {CommonFunction->Call('ln',@_)}
00104 sub logten {CommonFunction->Call('logten',@_)}
